ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Reponse to Jenn and the guy with the logon issues
ygData.msgSnippet: Forget this reply, I was behind in mail. I am glad to see my suggestion of background processes played out. way to go. Have fun Rob ...
ygData.messageBody:
Forget this reply, I was behind in mail.

I am glad to see my suggestion of background processes
played out.

way to go.

Have fun
Rob

--- Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@...> wrote:
> Did you try any of my suggestions?
> Don't worry that you got in, you still can't play.
> SOmething is wrong
>
> Rob
> --- muddywag <muddywag@...> wrote:
> > I got in! I had fun! then I tried to connect
> again
> > and... back to
> > desktop. now it boots me to the desk when I hit
> > options as well!!
> > luckilly, since I was able to finally register, I
> > can now post in
> > the tech help of the bb. iIf anyones interested
> its
> > there now with
> > all the dxinfo and sys info, under the name
> > muddywag1. --- In
> > EverQuest@y..., Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@y...> wrote:
> > > ahhhhh tooo funny I use the "Q" as well.
> > >
> > > as far as the person with the playing problems.
> > Here
> > > is what I would try:
> > >
> > > 1. uninstall everything associated with the game
> > > including Direct X., REBOOT,
> > > 2. Then download Direct x 8.1 from
> Microsoft.com.
> > > 3. install Direct x, REBOOT
> > > 4. Install EQ BUT BUT BUT, when you install it
> > this
> > > time, change the directory to something like
> c:\EQ
> > and
> > > not the default.
> > > 5. after installing eq reboot and try again ti
> run
> > >
> > > NOTES: if it still does not work, make sure your
> > > software firewall is not running, make sure you
> > are
> > > not running TOO high of a resolution for your
> > monitor.
> > > Most important, try shutting down any
> application
> > > running in the background you do not need, even
> > > disable antivirus software just as a test. I did
> > not
> > > say remove the anti-virus but disable it.
> > >
> > > Let us know if any of this helps
> > >
> > > Rob
> > >
> > >
> > > --- Jenn <juniper.jot@v...> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > By the way I did defrag(and needed it) but
> to
> > no
> > > > avail.
> > > > > My big question is why can't I post at the
> > > > station? I have cookies
> > > > > enabled, I'm signed in and it says "hi
> > muddywag"
> > > > at the top, but it
> > > > > keeps telling me that I need to be
> registered.
> >
> > > > AHHH! IWANNA KILL A
> > > > > BAT!! By the way I CAN play the tutorial.
> > Which
> > > > only served to let
> > > > > me know that I'll REALLY like this game-
> > someday!!
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > >
> > > > You can't post to the tech boards because you
> > don't
> > > > have an EQ account
> > > > yet. Until you finish the registration
> screens
> > in
> > > > the game your station
> > > > name and password isn't associated with an EQ
> > > > account.
> > > > Do yourself a favor and delete that tutorial.
> > If
> > > > it's the one you
> > > > download off the station's website, it's very
> > old.
> > > > It does give an idea
> > > > of gameplay but you'll still be very lost when
> > you
> > > > play for the first
> > > > time.
> > > > First thing you do when you do get a character
> > > > started is change where
> > > > the autoattack key is. Every newbie gets
> killed
> > > > trying to talk to thier
> > > > trainer because they don't hit enter before
> they
> > > > start to type
> > > > You click Options then Keyboard then click the
> > field
> > > > below Autoattack
> > > > then hit a key on the keyboard you don't think
> > > > you'll use often. Mine
> > > > is set to Q, some people use the Insert key.
> > Dont
> > > > use the numbers,
> > > > anything on the number pad, Pgup, Pgdown, or
> any
> > of
> > > > the Fkeys or arrow
> > > > key; all those have a use already in the game.
> > > >
> > > > Good luck
> > > > Bebinn Maolcataig
> > > > 24 Woodelf Druid
> > > > Dignatio cum Demori guild, Bertoxxulous server
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> > >
